content.raw:
Some errors appeared in my system, don't know if it is a problem at my end ...

```
roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia.launch
```
```
[ERROR] [1378830603.519046421]:     parent link 'l_situational_awareness_camera_frame' of joint 'l_situational_awareness_camera_optical_frame_joint' not found.  The Boxturtle urdf parser used to automatically add this link for you, but this is not valid according to the URDF spec. Every link you refer to from a joint needs to be explicitly defined in the robot description. To fix this problem you can either remove this joint from your urdf file, or add "<link name="l_situational_awareness_camera_frame" />" to your urdf file.
[ERROR] [1378830603.519162124]: failed to build tree
[ERROR] [1378830603.520199491]: Could not generate robot model
[ERROR] [1378830603.520244055]: Failed to extract kdl tree from xml robot description
```
content.html:
Some errors appeared in my system, don't know if it is a problem at my end ...

roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia.launch

[ERROR] [1378830603.519046421]:     parent link 'l_situational_awareness_camera_frame' of joint 'l_situational_awareness_camera_optical_frame_joint' not found.  The Boxturtle urdf parser used to automatically add this link for you, but this is not valid according to the URDF spec. Every link you refer to from a joint needs to be explicitly defined in the robot description. To fix this problem you can either remove this joint from your urdf file, or add "<link name="l_situational_awareness_camera_frame" />" to your urdf file.
[ERROR] [1378830603.519162124]: failed to build tree
[ERROR] [1378830603.520199491]: Could not generate robot model
[ERROR] [1378830603.520244055]: Failed to extract kdl tree from xml robot description

content.raw:
I think the `ros/atlas_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt` would be a bit more readable with the following patch:
~~~
diff -r 7f3a941b5339 ros/atlas_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/ros/atlas_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Sep 09 10:12:36 2013 -0700
+++ b/ros/atlas_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Sep 09 13:30:55 2013 -0700
@@ -7,9 +7,27 @@
 # compile using xacro
 
 if (HAVE_SANDIA_HAND)
-  set (model_basenames atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia_sandia_hands atlas_v3 atlas_v3_sandia_hands atlas atlas_cpu_lidar atlas_irobot_hands atlas_sandia_hands atlas_sandia_hands_stumps atlas_sandia_hands_cpu_lidar atlas_sandia_hands_stumps_cpu_lidar)
+  set (model_basenames
+       atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia
+       atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia_sandia_hands
+       atlas_v3
+       atlas_v3_sandia_hands
+       atlas
+       atlas_cpu_lidar
+       atlas_irobot_hands
+       atlas_sandia_hands
+       atlas_sandia_hands_stumps
+       atlas_sandia_hands_cpu_lidar
+       atlas_sandia_hands_stumps_cpu_lidar
+      )
 else()
-  set (model_basenames atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia atlas_v3 atlas atlas_cpu_lidar atlas_irobot_hands)
+  set (model_basenames
+       atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia
+       atlas_v3
+       atlas
+       atlas_cpu_lidar
+       atlas_irobot_hands
+      )
 endif()
 
 
~~~
Aside from that it looks good.
content.html:
I think the ros/atlas_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt would be a bit more readable with the following patch:

diff -r 7f3a941b5339 ros/atlas_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/ros/atlas_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt   Mon Sep 09 10:12:36 2013 -0700
+++ b/ros/atlas_description/robots/CMakeLists.txt   Mon Sep 09 13:30:55 2013 -0700
@@ -7,9 +7,27 @@
 # compile using xacro

 if (HAVE_SANDIA_HAND)
-  set (model_basenames atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia_sandia_hands atlas_v3 atlas_v3_sandia_hands atlas atlas_cpu_lidar atlas_irobot_hands atlas_sandia_hands atlas_sandia_hands_stumps atlas_sandia_hands_cpu_lidar atlas_sandia_hands_stumps_cpu_lidar)
+  set (model_basenames
+       atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia
+       atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia_sandia_hands
+       atlas_v3
+       atlas_v3_sandia_hands
+       atlas
+       atlas_cpu_lidar
+       atlas_irobot_hands
+       atlas_sandia_hands
+       atlas_sandia_hands_stumps
+       atlas_sandia_hands_cpu_lidar
+       atlas_sandia_hands_stumps_cpu_lidar
+      )
 else()
-  set (model_basenames atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia atlas_v3 atlas atlas_cpu_lidar atlas_irobot_hands)
+  set (model_basenames
+       atlas_v3_with_v1_inertia
+       atlas_v3
+       atlas
+       atlas_cpu_lidar
+       atlas_irobot_hands
+      )
 endif()

Aside from that it looks good.

content.raw:
Good point on the fisheye lens, I'll lower the hfov for now until we get the fisheye working.

Moved `<gazebo>` into `atlas_v3.gazebo`.
content.html:
Good point on the fisheye lens, I'll lower the hfov for now until we get the fisheye working.

Moved <gazebo> into atlas_v3.gazebo.

@hsu you can't simulate the SA fisheye cameras with the current gazebo cameras using flat projection (well, you can, but it results in a fairly bad rendering). Using such a large angle results in an extremely distorted image. In order to simulate a fisheye lens like the SA cameras have you'll need a simualted fisheye camera. To see the difference see these examples, and this image to see what it looks like in gazebo right now.

A camera with a smaller, less distorted fov would likely be more useful than the current solution until gazebo supports fisheye cameras.

Also, I think the gazebo camera definitions need to go into atlas_v3.gazebo instead of atlas_v3.urdf?

content.raw: I forgot to look at the hand orientation to figure out issue #348.
content.html: I forgot to look at the hand orientation to figure out issue #348.

content.raw:
I think there's still that problem with the effort limits on one of the legs. I grep 3 pairs of `+-260` in `drc_skeleton_v3_mod1.cfg` and only one pair of `+-110`. We previously dealt with this in pull request #191 and pull request #318.

I think the effort limits for `rleg_hpz` should be set to `+-110` to match what we did previously.

We could also mention this bug in the config file to @swillb
content.html:
I think there's still that problem with the effort limits on one of the legs. I grep 3 pairs of +-260 in drc_skeleton_v3_mod1.cfg and only one pair of +-110. We previously dealt with this in pull request #191 and pull request #318.

I think the effort limits for rleg_hpz should be set to +-110 to match what we did previously.

We could also mention this bug in the config file to @swillb

content.raw: Should we upload the `drc_skeleton_v3.cfg` to the atlas_utils/raw folder?
content.html: Should we upload the drc_skeleton_v3.cfg to the atlas_utils/raw folder?

content.raw: I didn't realize they changed the joint names. That `FindJoint` function is a good move. I did a quick check of some of the inertial symmetry using the [check_inertia_symmetry script](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/8dc059f11b8ab57c75709d0809cdf1465595b309/ros/atlas_utils/scripts/check_inertia_symmetry.bash?at=default), and it looks ok. I'm going to take a look at symmetry of the effort limits.
content.html: I didn't realize they changed the joint names. That FindJoint function is a good move. I did a quick check of some of the inertial symmetry using the check_inertia_symmetry script, and it looks ok. I'm going to take a look at symmetry of the effort limits.

update.title: copy new atlas_v3 model from catkinized branch into rosbuild version of drcsim

content.raw:
The installed `atlas_description` under `$CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX/share/drcsim-2.7/gazebo_models/atlas_description` is not a model or ros package, so I don't think it needs a `manifest.xml`.

There is a `ros/atlas_description/robots/atlas_v3_sandia_hands.urdf.xacro`, which should generate a plain urdf gazebo model.  Maybe you need to delete your `build/ros/atlas_description` to trigger a re-gen of the expanded urdf files?  Part of the reason we want to move to catkin :-)

To clarify, no launch-time xacro expansion should happen in this version of drcsim, not until catkinization happens in pull request #368.
content.html:
The installed atlas_description under $CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX/share/drcsim-2.7/gazebo_models/atlas_description is not a model or ros package, so I don't think it needs a manifest.xml.

There is a ros/atlas_description/robots/atlas_v3_sandia_hands.urdf.xacro, which should generate a plain urdf gazebo model. Maybe you need to delete your build/ros/atlas_description to trigger a re-gen of the expanded urdf files? Part of the reason we want to move to catkin :-)

To clarify, no launch-time xacro expansion should happen in this version of drcsim, not until catkinization happens in pull request #368.

content.raw:
For testing the bringup launch files I was trying to use this version 3 in one of the vrc scenarios. I found some problems:

* The manifest.xml installation in atlas_description is commented, we probably need this enable to make ros find this stack.
* There is no sandia-hand version of atlas v3 in plain urdf (it exists in xacro).
content.html:
For testing the bringup launch files I was trying to use this version 3 in one of the vrc scenarios. I found some problems:

  • The manifest.xml installation in atlas_description is commented, we probably need this enable to make ros find this stack.
  • There is no sandia-hand version of atlas v3 in plain urdf (it exists in xacro).
